intro: Xylia mendoncae, commonly known as the Mexican rosewood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Bignoniaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its dense, aromatic wood that is highly valued in woodworking. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Xylia mendoncae thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and economically important in traditional crafts.
